result.execSummary:
The defendant Evans L. Lewis Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Evans L. Lewis Jr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Evans L. Lewis Jr. was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive to Ct 2 and Ct 4 of 15CM723.
***AJOC - 2 yrs probation***

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include:  DV Counseling,  Psychiatric/psychological & Batterers treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Contact w/ Keyanna B as permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Evans L. Lewis Jr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 2 yrs probation Consecutive to Cts 2 and Ct 4 in 15CM723.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Def. appeared by phone from Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Court amends sentence on Count 2 to:  Sentence withheld, 2 years probation consecutive to Counts 2 and 4 in 15CM723.  Clerk to amend JOC and provide a copy to def. at Kettle Moraine as well as DOC.
With Joan/Kettle Moraine Correctional Institution a phone appearance is arranged for the deft for the TC on 7/18/16 at 8:15am.
from DOC re structure of sentence.
deft released from custody as to this file only.
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victim present and addressed.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 4 years probation consecutive to ct 2 of 15CM723 and concurrent to ct 4 of 15CM723.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney W Michel II.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, ct 1 is dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 5/9/16 at 2:30pm.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

Defendant Evans L. Lewis appeared with Attorney William Paul Michel.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Jennifer A. Phan appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JThwing. Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found. Bound over to Br .  Information filed, reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  DA Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *No Weapons.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *No Contact w/ Keyanna B or her residence.
941.30(2) Second Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Repeater, Use of Dangerous Weapon, DV   /   940.30 False Imprisonment, Repeater, DV, Use of Dangerous Weapon

138 p.m.  Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.    Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Kristyne Watson.  Clk  Janell Thwing. Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Defendant is on a PO Hold.   $1000 Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).
and witness list filed by the State
